title: The 10th-gen iPad is down to $350 at Target right now
content:
Macworld

Apple’s 10th-gen iPad may be hard to recommend at its full price, but when it’s cheaper than it’s ever been we’re going to tell you about it: Target is selling the 10th-gen iPad with 64GB of storage for $350 when you apply the Target Circle offer, a savings of $99 and the best price we’ve ever seen.

The 10th-gen iPad hit shelves last year and represented an inside-out overhaul of Apple’s entry level tablet, with a 10.9-inch display and an A14 processor. It ditches the Home button and moves the Touch ID sensor to the power button like the iPad mini. It also has full support for Apple’s just-released USB-C Apple Pencil for $79.

The 10 th-gen iPad is an excellent tablet but Apple has better options if you’re spending full price. At this discount it gets our full recommendation. Just note, you’ll need to sign up for a free Target Circle account to get this price.

iPad
